museums.name: Denver Art Museum
museums.description: One of the largest art museums between Chicago and the West Coast, featuring collections from around the world with a strong focus on American Indian art, Western American art, and modern design.

museums.name: Museo del Prado
museums.description: Spain's national art museum, home to one of the world's finest collections of European art. Features masterworks by Velázquez, Goya, El Greco, and other Spanish masters from the 12th to early 20th centuries.

content.text: The Museo del Prado is one of the most important art museums in the world. Founded in 1819, it houses the former Spanish Royal Collection of art, making it uniquely rich in works by Spanish masters.
In this lesson, we'll explore why the Prado matters, what makes it special, and prepare you for a deeper dive into Spanish art.
The Prado's collection includes over 8,000 paintings and thousands of sculptures, prints, and drawings. But don't worry—we'll focus on the highlights that matter most!

museums.name: The Louvre
museums.description: The world's largest and most visited art museum, housed in a historic palace. Home to the Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, and countless masterpieces from ancient civilizations through the 19th century.

museums.name: Kimbell Art Museum
museums.description: An intimate museum known for its exceptional collection of European masterworks and beautiful architecture by Louis Kahn. Houses works from antiquity through the 20th century.

museums.name: State Hermitage Museum
museums.description: One of the largest and oldest museums in the world, founded in 1764. Features over 3 million items including the largest collection of paintings in the world.

museums.name: Georgia O'Keeffe Museum
museums.description: The only museum in the United States dedicated to an internationally known woman artist. Features the world's largest collection of O'Keeffe's work.

museums.name: Uffizi Gallery
museums.description: One of the oldest and most famous art museums in the world, housing an unparalleled collection of Renaissance masterworks including Botticelli's Birth of Venus.

museums.name: Frida Kahlo Museum (Casa Azul)
museums.description: The former home of iconic Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, now a museum dedicated to her life and work. The blue house contains her personal belongings and artwork.
